related.description: Apollo Tyres Ltd. (APTY) rose to its highest in at least 22 years in Mumbai trading after Cooper Tire & Rubber Co. (CTB) dropped a $2.5 billion merger plan, easing investor concern the Indian company would take on too much debt. Shares of Apollo climbed 5.8 percent to 107.20 rupees, the highest close since at least January 1991.
related.title: Apollo Tyres Climbs After Cooper Tire Drops Merger Plan

related.description: A cross-border buyout that once valued Cooper Tire & Rubber Co. at $2.5 billion has now devolved into a court battle over as little as a few hundred million dollars. Cooper officially terminated its sale to India's Apollo Tyres Ltd. Monday after months of delay in which Apollo sought to cut the $35-a-share price.
related.title: Cooper Tire terminates $2.2 billion merger agreement with Apollo Tyres. $CTB

related.description: Anderson Cooper and Kathy Griffin seem like they are fully prepared to host CNN's New Year's Eve special again this year. However, we know that Griffin has a tendency to make Cooper a bit nervous, and this year she's starting ahead of time.
related.title: Anderson Cooper Tweets Nude Photo Of Kathy Griffin, Says It's Her NYE Outfit

title: STEP DOWN! The Free Cooper Union Salon
content:
The Free Cooper Union Salon-STEP DOWN! is a liberation of institutional space in the form of an art show on the 7th floor of Cooper Union's Foundation Building. In congruence with the ongoing and open occupation of President Jamshed Bharucha's office by the Students for a Free Cooper Union, STEP DOWN! showcases work from students, alumni, faculty, and the community at large that highlights the vision of Peter Cooper and the mission of the Cooper Union to provide 'Free Education to All' as a necessary social imperative.

STEP DOWN! pairs a community-based salon style art exhibit with open space dedicated to free and accessible education and liberating institutional resources. The exhibition will facilitate open space for dialogue through daily Open Forums and Free University classes visioning and reimagining new cooperative structures for higher education in the form of free performances, dialogues, screenings, classes, workshops, and more.

Historically, the 7th floor has been an integrated part of the annual Cooper Union End of Year Show (EOYS), which displays curated student work of all mediums. Students for a Free Cooper Union acknowledge that in lieu of the recent student-occupation of the President's office, STEP DOWN! remains officially unendorsed by the administration, and that due to the political nature of our work, the exhibit was omitted from the regular EOYS: SHOW UP program.

In light of the administration's continued efforts to marginalize and censor the work and efforts of the Cooper community, the entirety of the 7th floor has been reclaimed as free and open to the public for the duration of the show.

- Free Cooper Union

The Free Cooper Union Salon - STEP DOWN
May 28 through June 15
Open 12-7PM Tuesday - Saturday

7 East 7th Street 7th Floor
The Foundation Building
The Cooper Union

Opening Reception: Tonight, Tuesday, May 28 2013, 5-9 PM

entities.name: Free Cooper Union The Free Cooper Union Salon
